Reviews.Title: “Ocean City,MD”
Reviews.Author: azoak
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June. We were a party of 27. The location was great. You could walk out and the beach was right there. It was also walking distance to restaurants, the boardwalk,liquor store,etc. There was arestaurant upstairs for breakfast that was reasonable and the stff was pleasant. We went to our room and it was occupied.When we got a room, it was small in comparison to other rooms in our party and we were paying the same price. I asked about this at the front desk,but was told, no other rooms were available. The AC also did not work well and I had to call 3 times before it was fixed. They needed to tell me that we had to be in the room in order to fix it. I wrote a letter to the hotel plus filled out a survey online that was sent by the national office and never received a reply. I would stay there again,but ask for a room with two queens,in order to have more space,rather than a king.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised with shabbiness of room”
Reviews.Author: judy s
Reviews.Content: Was just there from 9-7-12 to 9-10-12 (room 609 to be exact). This was a suite and was very large. I had stayed there about 5 years ago, and was surprised with how everything has been allowed to become run down. I think the web site stated that the hotel had been renovated. Well, not the room we were in! The first thing that greets you was a large mashed-in vent in the hallway. Our bedroom had decent carpet in it--the beds were okay, but the pillows were terrible. On our balcony (the one off the bedroom), the screen was half torn off and never could have been used in case you wanted to leave the door open. The sofa bed in the bedroom was the most uncomfortable thing I ever sat on. When we first arrived, the room was blazing hot and we could not get the thermostat to work--called the front desk, was told that "maintenance would come check it out". They never showed up, but, on our own, we got it working. Since we had a suite, we also had our own private (and very large) porch that you could enter thru the atrium/living room. However, it appeared to be locked, and we could not get it opened. This also was reported to the front desk, and I saw the clerk write the request on a piece of paper for maintenance. Once, again, no one showed up, so this could never be used. The two sofas in the atrium were dirty and frayed on the edges. Just like other people have written, the indoor pool is not heated--in fact, it was very cold and also was not very clean. Didn't really have any problems with the clerks at the front desk. With the Quality Inn being a national chain, I expected more with this visit. Hotel rooms are not cheap, and I was dissapointed with my visit. I didn't pay for a worn out room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel. Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: rlm0607
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at this hotel. We booked about 8 weeks from our arrival date and got a really good rate. First I must tip my hat to all the staff. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. We actually arrived a few hours early and although our rooms were not ready (we didn't expect them to be) we were given a card to access the pool areas for the kids and called a short time later and told our room was ready. We booked 2 oceanfront rooms. The rooms were on the 8th and 4th floors. We had one king room and one double room. We had an awesome view of the ocean and the balconies were private. The rooms were very clean and spacious. The beds were comfortable and everything in the rooms was working properly. I'm not sure why so many people complain about the parking garage only going to the 4th floor because you can access the elevators from every floor. I felt it worked out just fine. At least you don't have to park 2 blocks away. Although this hotel is in desperate need of an update, it was clean and I would take clean over fancy any day. According to the managers response to other reviews, the hotel will get some updating this fall. Can't wait. All in all, we had a great vacation and will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Visit”
Reviews.Author: choomc
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 5 nights and had an oceanfront room on the 7th floor (room 707 to be exact). The room was large enough for us during our stay and had a private balcony. There are no safes in the room but rather at the front desk. Upon check in, we were never greeted warmly by the clerk. I would at least expect a "Welcome to the Quality Inn, blah, blah, blah." I believe all I got was a "Hello, how can I help you?" First impressions are everything in my opinion. While the mattresses were comfortable to me, the pillows were absolutely horrible. No support whatsoever. Your head just sank right down in the middle and given that we didn't sleep well on them. The room was clean enough for us. We had an issue with the a/c not cooling the room but maintenance came right up and tripped the circuit breaker and all was well after that until check out morning and the same problem occurred. My main concerns with the hotel is that the indoor pool does NOT get cleaned out on a daily basis and it is NOT heated. For 4 days straight, sand sat in the corners of the pool and just accumulated each day. I noticed on the day we checked out that it was finally vacuumed. The water also looked very murky each day. We complained to the front desk that the pool was not heated, even though the hotel claims it is and the temp was 80 degrees. We chose, instead, to use the outdoor pool. The other issue I have with this hotel is that the parking garage only goes to the 4th floor. The hotel has 8 floors. We always parked on the first or second level so that it made it easier to haul our gear to the beach each day. Our stay was better than most of the reviews you may read here. It seems to be hit or miss where and when you stay on this property.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel but needs better security”
Reviews.Author: Timmin215
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel numerous times over the last 8 years, and have always been satisfied. The location is unbeatable,close enough yet far enough from the boardwalk. We always book an oceanfront room and although they are in need of updating, they are adequate for our purpose. We are always there during the shoulder season, (early June or Late August) The last three years, we were there for the OC air show, which unfortunatley overlaps with senior week, and the unruly crowds that accompany it. Our car was vandalized in the hotel garage. There are no security cameras anywhere, nor are there room safes. A little investment in security would go a long way here. Front desk staff range from totally indifferent to bend over backwards to help you

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised and would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: SherrybabyOakdale
Reviews.Content: We had a great room with kitchenette, and terrace overlooking the bay. With this view you also faced the main road, but was fairly quiet. The bathroom was a bit worn but fine, nonetheless. The service was friendly and helpful. Location to the beach was great and not too far from the boardwalk. There was only a breakfast restaurant but there was no lack of food and staff members were gracious in their recommendations.Not too fancy but great! I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Needs Renovated”
Reviews.Author: wkkwk
Reviews.Content: Certainly not worth $300+ per night for a King Jacuzzi Suite - luckily I had enough ChoiceHotel points to stay for FREE. Only positive is the location of the hotel - beachfront and quiet. The bathroom was in desperate need of a complete renovation. Housekeeping replaced the towels, replaced the toiletries, and made the bed; however, I know for a fact that the room was not vacuumed because we were sitting on the balcony while housekeeping was there. Not planning to stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel stay ever!”
Reviews.Author: Jerseygirl08081
Reviews.Content: I visited with my parents and year old son, we booked an ocean front and when we got there we were told no ocean fronts were available. The room we were given was filthy, I killed several flying bugs within my first 5 mins in the room, my son and I have several bites. The carpets are digustingly dirty, the tub was dirty, the bathroom door and cabinets were rotted, the ceiling had water stains and some of the tiles were moved out of place. I was highly upset by the conditions of the room and my vacation lacked all it could have been because of our poor quality inn hotel. ONLY thing I will say is the restaurant served a delicious breakfast and the housekeeper was honest and brought me my purse I forgot behind.

Reviews.Title: “Was concerned with some of the reviews, but was very pleased.”
Reviews.Author: Ashly K
Reviews.Content: I looked for days online for a hotel because I wanted something beachfront and nice but affordable. I wasn't sure what to expect because this hotel has about half good reviews and half bad, but I was very happy aside from a couple minor things. The location is the BEST-you're kinda off in your own corner but everything is pretty much in walking distance and the hotel is very quiet, which I loved. I didnt want to be on the boardwalk because of noise. The staff was all very nice and made us feel welcome with any questions. AC worked great..The only thing I did notice is they need to be a little more thorough with cleaning, there was a big glob of hair in some of the corners and I could not find the Jacuzzi its suppose to have. Other than that I will stay here again next year! Great Place!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Wellnessfun
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at this hotel. Our ocean front room was much larger than expected room and was very clean. The lobby was hot, but we only passed through a few times. Would definitely recommend this location.

Reviews.Title: “ZERO-Quality Inn”
Reviews.Author: MCH172
Reviews.Content: Before leaving from PA (3 and a half hr drive), I looked at the reviews and tried to not take much thought of the horrible reviews (everyone has their own opinion, right?). Well I wish I would of listened! This place is horrible! Like said in other reviews, location was good; 5 minute walk to the end of the boardwalk, steps from the beach, steps from Higgins and Anthony's Beer & Wine. But that was the only plus! After traveling, we arrived earlier than check in (said we could probably check in early). Check in is at 4pm, which you also get charged a full day for! Our room (a suite) was not ready until 3:50pm (also other angry customers waiting to check in), making us wait around the entire day while getting charged for it! During the check-in, it seemed as if they cared MORE about the customers getting the regular rooms than the customers who are paying more for suites. The suites are TINY. I wouldn't even call them a suite. The towels were DISGUSTING. Most of them had stains on them which grossed me out to even touch. Housekeeping was friendly. They have 3 poors, two outdoors one indoors. The HUGE outdoor pool wasn't even filled and the other outdoor pool on the 4th floor was TINY; didn't even bother to go into the indoor pool. The kitchen in the suite was terrible; small oven, small sink (could hardly do dishes). Air conditioners were loud. They don't even give full sized pillows on the bed. PLEASE save your money and go elsewhere. We actually headed over to the Hilton next door and sat at their pool bar which was very very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Ignored Beach Front Property”
Reviews.Author: Bretta F
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd year staying at this hotel and it will be our last. Our whole family goes and we get a total of 4 rooms ocean front rooms for the week. We have 11 kids and don't need the "best" and are a very casual family. So while reading this review take that in to account. The location of the hotel is perfect but the hotel becomes more and more run down year after year. Rooms were supposed to be renovated so we asked for them and told we would have them. In one room the oven didn't work and in another the dishwasher didn't work and it was obvious it didn't work for awhile. The chlorination equipment at the outside pool malfunctioned (exploded) and we were evacuated for 2 hours. That could have been an accident but you have to wonder if it was taken care of as it seems as nothing else in the hotel has been. The inside pool was disgusting and had a film on the water. The staff at the front desk were very inattentive and not very friendly. They acted like interrupting them from their personal conversations was a problem. The maid service was excellent. The maintenance men were excellent. I can only imagine the calls they get about having to fix things. This hotel is not worth the price at all. At that cost, things could be upgraded and renovated. My advice would be to choose a different hotel even if you have to pay a little more. When you are paying $279 a night, things should be better.

Reviews.Title: “Unwanted waiting”
Reviews.Author: Hubeco
Reviews.Content: I am sure everybody that read these reviews and says yeh right. But what I am about to write is the truth no doubt about it. When we booked the suite the individuals told us they had queen size beds, wrong... They are only full size. When we booked the room they told us we could probably get in early.. Wrong. We waited till 4pm to get in and charged a full day. They were not only us but a ton of people who rented the suites all waiting till 4and after..the suites are very tiny. No cooking untensils and pots. Nothing. So why have a kitchen if you don't provide the things to cook with. There is no air condition in the lobby it is hot as hell in there. Other than the view please do not book here. Spend the money elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “maybe in a pinch...”
Reviews.Author: mal
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location isn't bad...a short walk to the end of the boardwalk and across from jolly roger etc. We had a room on the 4th floor, our "patio" was an extension of the pool's deck, which was OK. I liked the fact that we could park in the garage right outside of the room. When we got to the room it was pretty hot and humid inside...cranked up the AC and waited for it to cool down, but it never cooled down. I talked to a girl at the front desk the next morning and she said she'd send somebody up to look at the AC. By 5 p.m. no one had been there, so I went back down and talked to a guy (not sure of his name, but he was a nice guy and helpful). Maintenance came up and we came back an hour later, still no AC. Fortunately, it wasn't a killer heat weekend, so we lived with it and they took some $ off of our bill. I guess if I wanted to be a jerk I could have really made a big stink, but I just hate doing that.... Anyway, it wasn't the Grand, or the Hilton, or the Marriott, but it was OK for a couple day getaway...

Reviews.Title: “moe6022@aol.com”
Reviews.Author: maureen e
Reviews.Content: will not come back to that dump!!! NO AIRCONDITION INSIDE LOBBY THROUGHOUT THE HOTEL EVEN WORKERS HAD PORTABLES FANS ON THEM THE EXERCISE ROOM NO AC HOW CAN YOU EXERXCISE WHEN THE ROOM WAS SO HOT GIVE YOURSELF A HEART ATTACK!!!!! we ask them about it they said gave some excuse space wasnt big enough,, first day arrive little early so they said go to pool, we went to pool had to use bathroom it was dirty bugs dead all over toliet dirty.. we called desk they sent someone up i watch them they just change towelpaper didnt not clean up bathroom. then room was ready the breakers kept going out had no ac finally had it working,, woke up 3am found 2 bugs in bathroom.. ask housekeeping to gives us new towels, never change our sheets,, never stay at quiality inn never again dissappointed in the beaches so much gabbage on them people need to wake up keep our beaches clean dont through there gabbage on the beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Spend your money elsewhere - this place is DIRTY!”
Reviews.Author: heyhowru2006
Reviews.Content: Do not believe the pictures you see - this place is a hole. The other "Quality" Inns are better. There is an outdoor pool that has been closed for years - there is another one, but VERY small and on the rooftop - making access to the beach impossible. Rooms haven't been renovated in many years. Indoor pool is dirty. Don't let the lobby fool you as it is the only decent looking area in the whole hotel. Feel free to contact me if you have any further questions! GO ELSEWHERE! The Hilton next door is more expensive, but might be worth it. D

Reviews.Title: “Leaves so much to be desired...”
Reviews.Author: gppwow
Reviews.Content: All you are getting with this hotel is the location on the beach. If that is all you want, this is your place. If you want helpful staff, clean rooms, clean carpets, working mechanicals,something built in the last 30 thirty years, PLEASE GO ELSEWHERE. My girlfriend and I booked this place for a weekend getaway. And if we could have found someplace else to stay, that is what we would have done, gotten away from here!!! The hotel is used hard by the tourist trade, and is not kept up to any standard of cleanliness. Keep your shoes on! Can't understand anyone giving this place any more than a 2.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and views!”
Reviews.Author: afsw68
Reviews.Content: We stayed here memorial day weekend - got great huge room on high floor - corner with balcony - we had a view in 3 directions from outside - right overlooking beach. Room was a bit dated, but clean and gigantic. Kitchen was a real plus!

Reviews.Title: “If I could rate worse I would. Horribly dirty, saw 2 bed bugs on wall. After fighting with front desk about getting a different”
Reviews.Author: Dqz011p
Reviews.Content: DIRTY!!! If I could rate worse I would. Horribly dirty, saw 2 bed bugs on wall. After fighting with front desk about getting a different room, they isisted I take a smoking room. I had my 1 year old.. Really?

Reviews.Title: “Repeat customer”
Reviews.Author: D S
Reviews.Content: My family returns to OC every summer and this has worked out to be the best value for the way we vacation. In room kitchens make up for no free breakfast. We sun at the beach, eat breakfast and lunch in and go out for dinner and activites in the evening. The location is perfect for us- close enough to walk to the Boardwalk (albeit 3 miles) if we desire, but far enough away we feel safe giving our teens a little space. Viewing this years airshow from balcony or beach was great. The rooms could be just a bit cleaner- but you should see our room after my family of 6 has been in it for week - big job for anybody. Two pools, one in and one out is a must for uncooperative weather. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing time”
Reviews.Author: Holly M
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, My boyfriend and I stayed on the 6th floor which had an amazing view. Our favorite part was the tub!!! LOVED IT! The whole staff was nice which was a plus. Our room was not dirty at all! Actually one of the cleanest hotels Ive been too! The location was perfect we just walked straight out to the beach. Im going to come back next year for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine9928
Reviews.Content: I said that I was not coming back after my last trip, but I did. Big Mistake!! Front desk staff are very friendly and helpful. The location is great and easy to find. Now for the bad stuff. I stayed on the 7th floor...great view, but the hotel parking garage only goes to the 4th floor. So you must park on one floor and enter thru the floor to the elevator to go to your room. The entrance door is dirty and needs to be painted. Then the hallway smells..enter your room which also has a smell. Glad I brought my cleaning supplies. Kitchen was as clean as it could be,but I would rather not use it. The stove eyes were off centered and seemed broken. Frig had water leaking on the bottom shelf. Curtains need cleaned, sofa and pillows dirty. Sheets not int the best shape. I thought that house cleaning would put clean sheets on the bed when doing room service. This was not the case. Bathroom clean,but needs upgraded. Everything int the hotels needs upgraded. The worse thing is the loud A/C. I'll be at another hotel next year!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view!”
Reviews.Author: mjwood
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed here the first week of April. It is not located on the boardwalk, which is what we wanted. We stayed in an oceanfront room on the corner of the 5th floor. The room was huge, at least 40 ft. long. It was a suite, which included a kitchen, living room, two bathrooms and a king size bed. Being on the corner, you had a view of the bay and the ocean. The view was amazing!!! The room needs a little updating, but it was clean. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Seemed a bit worn, but still nice.”
Reviews.Author: dallenmurphy
Reviews.Content: We checked in on a Friday. We arrived a bit early, but our room was ready anyway so, good start. King-sized bed was comfortable. Great ocean view. Room had a small kitchen, which came in very handy. This was pre-season, and the AC didn't seem to be on yet, but we wanted the sliding doors open anyway so no big deal. The room was clean enough, but had a slight smell. Again, keeping the sliding doors open took care of that. The staff were very nice and attentive. The hotel restaurant served a good breakfast, and the staff there were nice as well. We'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach, but really needs updating”
Reviews.Author: RLCarmichael
Reviews.Content: We did a quick weekend trip off season. Wasn't expecting new but the place really is dated. First off, the staff was friendly and welcoming. But it's been along time since the room had been remodeled. We had a king room on the 8th floor with sofa bed and deluxe bath including 2 person(?) whirlpool tub. Everything in the bath was in good working order but the toilet seat had been cleaned so many times that the color surface had worn off. Come on, I'm a landlord...toilet seats aren't that expensive! The bed was comfortable (but not new) and we slept well. Sheets were in good condition and the pillows were actually decent for motel pillows. But MAN the room felt like a 70's flashback. The lamps were. shall we say, retro, and of the 4 lamps in the room, 2 matched but they all worked. Room did have a flat screen HDTV. The stove - WOW. It is a efficiencycenicy unit that would be fine but this looked like they had had it forever. The burners didn't sit flat, and the drip pans were gross. The oven interior was dirty. The sliding glass door inside trim was about to fall off. Didn't hit the indoor pool but it looked pretty nice. The exercise room was REALLY lacking. Two old stair climbers, one treadmill, and a bike. The bike wasn't plugged in so you couldn't use any of the features. And the treadmill worked but it was marginal. My guess it that the place has been updated in the past, but it's past due again. Great beach and I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Big room,nice view....needs major updating!”
Reviews.Author: Julie W
Reviews.Content: Our room was on the first floor (oceanfront). The room was a great size, liked the his/her bathrooms, and the view was great. The front desk staff were very nice. On the down side, the room needed updating big time! The curtains were filthy, the carpet was very stained, the wallpaper was peeling up, and a lot of the wood (bathroom sink, door, etc) was splitting and rotting. This could be an excellent hotel, if they just updated some things!

Reviews.Title: “weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: connie o
Reviews.Content: i was so upset with the whole place the front desk was good but the room was dirty and very dustie you could write your name in the dust on the headboard and lamps. the floors were dirt. the pool area was dirty with little stones and all the windows in the place was nasty.sauna doors are old and wore out needs new stain on them to freshin up some the place needs a new cleaning crew for sure

Reviews.Title: “Birthday getaway”
Reviews.Author: nornette1977
Reviews.Content: Love room, ocean view, clean room, love the big tub.... NEED TO UPDATE THE KICHEN STOVE ASAP..... front desk was very nice..

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DustyKitty
Reviews.Content: My husband took me to Ocean City for Valentine's Day, and we chose this hotel because it had a heated indoor pool and hot tub. We have stayed at other Quality Inn properties, but this was our first time here. We were greeted by Jennifer at the front desk, and check-in was completed quickly. Jennifer also offered a list of restaurants that were open during the off season. Our room was clean and spacious, with 1.5 bathrooms and a complete mini-kitchen. Beds were comfortable, and furniture in the sitting area was comfortable as well. The restaurant was only open for breakfast, but the food was hot, servings were large, and the waitresses were so friendly and attentive. We thoroughly enjoyed the indoor pool and hot tub. They also have a game room and exercise room. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: LovetoTravelnEatOut
Reviews.Content: We rented a room with 1.5 bathrooms rather than the standard 1, which worked out better for us. We were on the 2nd floor and the view was great from there. Some of the rooms have entrance doors on the outside of the building; it was winter so we asked for a room with an interior entrance doors. They have a nice indoor pool, Jacuzzi and sauna. Not sure if there is an outdoor pool as it was winter and it would have been closed anyway. And because it was winter, we had the pool to ourselves. There is also a small game room, a couple of the games were not working but most were and they also had a pool table. There are vending machines with snacks in the game room, which is on the 2nd floor. The room was clean and equip with a full fridge, pots/pans, knives/forks and a large microwave. There is a high rise parking lot attached, so you can park on the same level as your room and enter the building on that floor (with an access key), so that makes it easier to get luggage in and out. The restaurant had the best value breakfast we have ever had in Ocean City with specials that included coffee and juice. The breakfast was huge. Not sure if it was just a fluke because it was off season, but it was so worth the money. The Waitresses in the restaurant were so wonderful. We have stayed here several times before and certainly will again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: LRBrain
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter stayed here in January for a church retreat at the OC Convention Center. After she got home, she realized that she couldn't find her Ipod. It took me about two weeks to call Quality Inn and ask about their "lost and found." The woman who answered was extremely competent. Apparently, she had called our church and reported that they had found an Ipod. They had already had it packaged at the front desk. She told me that it was ready to be sent out. I believe this indicates an extremely caring group of employees; they are a true credit to the hotel. I want to praise the integrity and thoughtfulness. I hope the manager reads this and commends his very efficient staff.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay at this location again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine9928
Reviews.Content: My family takes a annual trip to the beach in May of every year. We planned on staying in the same hotel as we did the previous year, but the hotel was closed. After looking at some reviews I decided to stay at the Quality Inn. I'm a Choice Hotel Member so I'm always looking to stay at one of their hotels to gain points. When we arrived the front desk stay was wonderful. I spoke with a lady named Tara and she was extremely friendly and helpful. Once I arrived at my room everything changed. The room was clean, but extremely dated. A/C was extremely loud which made it extremely hard to sleep. The view was amazing and it was great to be beachfront even though the weather was very cold and we couldn't enjoy the beach. I would give this hotel a 6 out of 10

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable, but you can do better”
Reviews.Author: hawknoah
Reviews.Content: Overall, the Quality Inn Oceanfront did the job, but I was expecting better. On the plus side, the price was fair, the location was good (end of the boardwalk), and there was a large, inviting indoor pool and hot tub. The room was very large and seemed even larger because the ceilings were extremely high (I'm guessing 15 feet in our room). It had a king sized bed that seemed overly soft, but I must admit I slept very well. The TV was a current wide screen LCD with an adequate number of stations. There was a good sized fridge with icemaker and microwave and even a skinny oven in the room, although we only used the freezer to chill a bottle of wine we bought. There was a good sized balcony where we could see the ocean, although it was too cold to go out there. On the negative side, the room was in need of a general makeover. The green carpet was stained and a few years past its expiration date - there was a slight funny smell in the room, undoubtedly caused by the carpet. The shower drain was clogged and the showerhead needed replacing badly. The worst part is that as we opened the door to our non-smoking room, there was always an odd rush of cigarette smoke that dissipated after we walked in, so I'm not sure where it was coming from. There were some fairly noisy things going in the room (various motors and fans, but I'm not sure) which woke my wife up at times. In terms of amenities, there was a fitness room that had some old cardio pieces, three of the four seemed to work but it was inadequate even for a hotel fitness room. There was a restaurant that served breakfast (not included with room), but we didn't try it as it didn't look too inviting. As I mentioned, the pool looked great, and it was constantly crowded. There was a game room that had some pinball and arcade games that looked to be in the neighborhood of 20+ years old. There was free wi-fi, although in our room, it wasn't really faster than 3G on my phone. I would recommend this hotel to others, with the caveat that there are better choices. I think in the future, I'll pay the extra 5-10 per night for the Holiday Inn instead, but it got the job done.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a serious update”
Reviews.Author: carLehighton_Pa
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights, 6/7 Jan 2012. Great location and room layout, friendly and helpful staff. But, the place needs a serious update. Very uncomfortable bed and pillows as well as the sofa and chair. Very noisy heating system. Kitchen appliances were very shabby; we would not have used them had we been so inclined. The balcony as well as the balcony furniture were dirty, not conducive to spending time there. We would stay there again ONLY after renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Old and dirty”
Reviews.Author: Ashley680
Reviews.Content: I previously lived in OCMD with my boyfriend, and we thought we would come down for the New Year, since we were missing the beach atmosphere. Finding a reasonably priced hotel was our goal, so we chose this one. I read reviews and assumed people were just being picky, but no. People, trust the reviews!!! I was promised wireless internet (like stated on their very own webpage), we arrive and are placed in a room OUTSIDE.. yes it was december/january. NOT in the hotel itself. Not that big of a deal, just a little chilly to walk in the OUTSIDE hallways. That was my first issue. Second, the wireless. I immediately tried connecting, no server available. I called to the front desk, they informed me their wireless has been down and it may not work, but it may not work because of how far AWAY our room was from the wireless router in the INSIDE of the hotel. The lady suggested we decide RIGHT now if we want to switch rooms to attempt to get wireless, or deal and basically hung up on me. Ok, so we went to the front office to check to see if the wifi worked there, indeed it did but was VERY slow, couldn't even load up the internet. So, we did not switch rooms afterall. So, we are checking out our room after this wifi nonsense, cracks all over the walls, high ceilings with spiderwebs and dust HANGING down from it. The kitchenette area was very old, made me feel dirty looking at it. Note, I am a 23 year old who LIVED in college dormitories and houses with people, I am not the pickiest, so if you have children, I would suggest away from this place. The bathroom, gross. the shower floor was BLACK/BROWN, no mat down. FOUL! The light fixture had dust hanging down from it. The only plus to this place was the balcony, which was a wrap around since we were on the corner/outside of the building. Overall, I would not suggest this place unless there is NO OTHER place available. I got the dirty vibe from the second I walked into the place. And being lied to about wifi is ridiculous, just don't offer it if you don't have it!

Reviews.Title: “old, shabby, dirty and tourist unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: mar m
Reviews.Content: This a horrible hotel. Do not stay here for the following reasons: 1. appliances were old and dirty 2. upon entering, our room smelled musty 3. housekeeping was a joke/non-existent 4. bathroom floor tiles were broken and were a trip hazard 5. no business center for patrons..i.e computer or printer 6. no free continental breakfast 7. parking garage was not properly lit 8. HVAC system was deafening when in use Perhaps because this was a beachfront hotel, the owners felt as though they did not have to properly care for the patrons. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY. STAY AT YOUR OWN RISK.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised; well worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: Mike L
Reviews.Content: A little hard to get to if you are heading south due to the one-way street(s) off Coastal Highway. Our GPS didn't do well... However, upon arrival we received a very friendly reception and early check-in to our room. Opted for an oceanfront king room with jacuzzi tub and kitchen. Room was very clean; carpeting had just been shampooed earlier in the day so was a little damp. Balcony was nice, with great direct view of the beach. Kitchen was very outdated with smallest appliances (stove/oven, dishwasher). we've ever seen. Didn't use either as it was a single overnight ate we ordered out for food. Jacuzzi was a newer upgrade and we had a separate shower in nice-sized bathroom. Hotel has both indoor and outdoor pools and is very convenient to numerous restaurants. We'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: KCashVa
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze and we were able to check in 2 hours early. We had room #104 which is right across from the indoor pool and hot tub. Noise was not a factor. The rooms are LARGE. Twice the size of what we are used to in Ocean City. We had 2 double beds, one full bath and one private toilet room. Very nice. There is a fold out couch, comfy chair and two end tables that we used for our laptops. There are even plenty of electrical outlets! There is a small table with two chairs for eating, working, whatever. The kitchen has a full size fridge, oven, microwave and sink. Some of the cabinets doors are glued shut, but this was not a problem for us. There is a 2 cup coffee maker, coffee, cream, sugar, etc. There are pots, pans, utensils and silverware but not very many. Plenty of plates, cups and glasses. The balcony was spacious with two comfortable chairs and a table. I would have preferred a higher floor for a better view, but that was not a big deal. There is a flat screen tv, large closet, and plenty of space to put away folded clothing. The beds are comfortable but the pillows are super soft. The carpeting was wrinkling up...but I suppose that is common at the beach. Plenty of towels and toiletries. Water pressure in the shower was kind of low. Bath tub had jacuzzi jets, but we did not use that. Breakfast in the restaurant on the 2nd floor was just OK. There is plenty of parking in the attached garage. The only downfall (during the summer) is no outdoor pool. I would definately stay here again and recommend it to friends/family going to OC in the off season.

Reviews.Title: “Very Accommodating”
Reviews.Author: Lenny L
Reviews.Content: The service was great and hospitality was very accommodating. The room was spacious, beautiful and clean. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Security issues”
Reviews.Author: Kathy_travel134
Reviews.Content: Used to stay here and it was very nice back then. We usually go to the one on 16th St. b/c we like being on the boardwalk, but they had no availability,so we came back to 33rd St. Stayed here Oct 21 - 24th, 2011 and were very disappointed. The pool was filthy, but not as bad as the hottub (Cold & dirty tub). The toilet in our room was dirty and the usual soaps, lotions, etc. were not there. Not a big deal since we bring our own toiletries. But what I found so upsetting was when I returned to our room one evening and realized I did not have my key. I didn't need it b/c our door was open!!! I closed it tight and when my husband returned and tried to unlock the door, neither his key, nor mine (which he had), would unlock the door. I let him in and told him the situation. He went down to the front desk and told them the story & and received an earful of badmouth on the employee who made our original keys. But no apology about our door being open. The next day, we took note of housekeeping cleaning several rooms at once. The doors to 4 rooms were propped open, & she would go do something in one room, then the next, & so on. Then she would go back to the 1st room, then the 2nd, and do the same routine with all 4 still being propped open. These were not all unoccupied rooms - personal belongings were still in the rooms. The day checked out, I again reported that our room had been left open (to a different person) and was told I probably didn't pull it tight. I said we always double check it. She laughed and said maybe housekeeping did it. To me, this is a serious issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great 5th floor Beachfront Condo”
Reviews.Author: edanddebra
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 5th floor condominium which was very large and comfortably furnished. They say it has 5 bedrooms but one of them had a pull out sofa instead of a regular bed. The views were great with a large wrap around porch. You can see the sunrise over the ocean and the sunset in the bay. You can see pictures of this place on their website. The kitchen was fully functional and it had 2 dishwashers which is nice for a large group. Although strangely, they didn't have enough dishes, cups, or silverware to fill the 2 dishwashers or for that matter to meet the needs of the 12 person capacity. Some of the pots and pans were missing lids and there were no cookie sheets, but there are 3 coffee pots. There are no spices or condiments which we've seen in other places, not even salt and pepper. We stayed with another family and really enjoyed being able to be together in the large living areas or keeping to ourselves if we wanted since there were 2 separate living rooms with large flatscreen TVs. The showers were tiled and worked well except the water temperature fluctuated wildly when a toilet was flushed or for some other reason we couldn't identify. Also, in the beachfront bedrooms, you could hear the railing rattling loudly when it was windy. The game room was tiny and the games were expensive. The exercise room was tiny too. But the indoor pool was nice with a hot tub and sauna. And there was an open shower that was warm and convenient for rinsing off before and after swimming. We stayed after Labor Day in mid September so we were able to get a great price. Otherwise I doubt we could have afforded to stay here during the busy season. We timed our stay to be after bike week which is too noisy, scary, and raunchy at the boardwalk for our family with young girls. Also, the water temperature was fairly warm even though it was only in the 70s during most of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Debby830
Reviews.Content: We spent all of last week at this hotel on the second floor (ocean front) and had a wonderful stay! We had problems last year when we stayed (we've been staying here for many years) and decided it was just a fluke so we went back this year and have absolutely no regrets. The room was clean and all the linens on the bed were fresh and the staff at the front desk and cleaning personnel were friendly and courteous at all times. We could tell they have been doing so updating to the rooms/furnishings and couldn't find one single thing to complain about. We just love this hotel because of the prices, cleanliness and location and will continue to stay here year after year!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for a Beach Weekend”
Reviews.Author: jtwned24
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretty nice. Be sure to reserve an oceanfront room they have great views. The only problem we had was we were told that we would have a room on the upper floors and we were given a first floor room when we arrived. The person we reserved with had not even written it down. View was OK but dunes did block some. Be sure to have breakfast in the restaurant in the hotel, it was great. Overall, it is a great hotel for a weekend at the beach that is surrounded by lots of attractions and dining.

Reviews.Title: “it was ok”
Reviews.Author: connie o
Reviews.Content: i stayed for the weekend it was ok didnt care for the food in the lunch room and the pool area leaked when it rained and the gym equippment was old and the room was boring,the game room was no fun either. the back of the hotel was nasty looking i liked my next hotel i stayed at better overall it was better

Reviews.Title: “Just okay :(”
Reviews.Author: choomc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights at the end of August. Booked an oceanfront room and was given room 609 which was an oceanfront corner room that had 2 balconies which did not connect...not a big deal but we mostly stayed on the smaller balcony as the larger balcony was very windy. The room had a sleeping area w/TV and a separate living/dining area with TV. As most reviewers have noted, the hotel is dated in it's decor. The rugs in the halls were stained/dirty. I found the staff to be pleasant at check in/out. The main issue I had with check-in is the actual unloading of your car. There is a VERY small loading area in front of the lobby and if there is another car in front of you parked in just a way that you can't get around it, then you must wait until that person moves their car. Luckily, by the time we dropped our bags off in our room, the car in front of us had moved and we were able to park our car in the garage. The indoor pool is not heated as the hotel claims. For the 5 days we stayed here, not once was the indoor pool or the jacuzzi vacuumed out. The same sand sat at the bottom of both pool and spa for our duration. Also, the indoor pool's water was so very cloudy during our stay that I have to wonder if it was just too much chlorine or the lack of it being cleaned daily. The outdoor shower/faucet to rinse your feet off after leaving the beach had broken handles so the water could only trickle at ALL times and wasn't effective at rinsing sand off your feet. We ended up using the bathrooms in the indoor pool area because those showers had much better water pressure. We also had an issue with our shower drain not draining. We called maintenance twice, can only assume they came while we were out, but the shower water continued to pool at our feet during our showers. Overall, just an okay stay. The hotel's cleanliness is a big turnoff and I am not sure if I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice amenities, but could use some renovation”
Reviews.Author: elcentro1
Reviews.Content: I loved the location. It wasn't bad, but I had some concerns about it. When we first checked in, I got frustrated because I didn't know where I had to go to get to our room. Now visualize this. We got up to the 8th floor, as our room was 803. After we got off the elevator, we followed the signs, but couldn't find room 803. So I had to go back down to the desk and ask about it. Here, it is a seperate door you have to go through, in order to get to the rooms that face the ocean. Gee, thanks for NOT marking that door so people like my wife and I would know. The room was clean. But the wallpaper had that light pastels abstract art design to it, that seemed to have been more popular in the 1980s. It reminded me of Miami Vice, and was expecting Don Johnson and Phillip Michael Thomas to come barging into the room. I loved that our room had a balcony and faced the ocean, and had a kitchen. But, we as avid coffee drinkers were not happy to discover that our coffee maker did not work, and we wasted some good Starbucks ground coffee, when it did not filter, and we had a mess to clean up. Luckily, the Hilton next door sold Starbucks coffee, which took care of that problem. They did replace the coffee maker, though. We cooked breakfast the next morning, which was nice. There is a small grocery store called Anthony's, practically in front of the hotel, on the main road there. But for the stove, one of the four coil burners was not working. The one other concern I had was the door to the room. At the very bottom corner, there was a chunk missing, and you could see sunlight coming through it. This is a door that leads to the outside, and not an indoor hallway. If this was winter time, cold air would have been seeping in. The hot tub downstairs was nice, but the indoor pool was a bit chilly. The outdoor pool was actually a bit warmer. So, this hotel wasn't too bad and it served its purpose. But, it could use some upgrading.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back.... ever”
Reviews.Author: 112263Ontario
Reviews.Content: Location is really nice - walking out onto the beach is great, but Quality Inn can't take credit for the nice beaches. At least they put the windows in the right spot overlooking the ocean, otherwise I wouldn't be able to find one good thing about this place to write about! I will simply back up what other reviewers have said about the state of cleanliness - no point going over that in too much detail. It's simply dirty and filthy. And it's apparent the management doesn't take any complaints seriously as things haven't changed at all. The place is filthy. We had to hunt staff down for our little bottles of shampoo and even for towels one day! You walk away with the sense that staff really don't care at all, hate their jobs, and feel secure in not doing their jobs. This is no way to run a service business. And, to top it off, housecleaning stole doughnuts out of our fridge..... does that not speak volumes of the morale of hotel staff when they take to raiding our fridge and eating our doughnuts? We had a good laugh over that one, and left a note for the next foraging cleaner that we're sorry, we're fresh out of doughnuts but to check next week when some other poor unsuspecting client loads up on Entemanns! We loved OCMd and will be back... but not at this place. Do yourself a favour - take the negative reviews seriously and pick a hotel rated above this one. There are LOADS of choices!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Filthy... go anywhere but here”
Reviews.Author: 454231Canada
Reviews.Content: We chose to ignore earlier reviews about the lack of cleanliness in this hotel, thinking we weren't the types to be put off by a few dirt stains, especially in a beach-focused hotel which tend to suffer more wear and tear... but this place is truly filthy. And the cleaning staff just put no effort at all in keeping the place at a minimal standard of cleanliness. The room was adequately clean when we got there - and it became less and less cleaned as time went by. This place has seen better days, and hasn't put any effort into raising its minimal standard. The location is outstanding, right on the beach. And OCMD was a great place to vacation with the family - we will definitely return to OC, but never to this hotel. Way over-priced, dirty, bored and lazy staff, room never cleaned well, dirty indoor pool... We will never recommend this place to anyone we know going to OC, but have a HUGE list of other hotels to pick from, and we'll be staying at one of those next time.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: JW75
Reviews.Content: 2nd year in a row and once again,was a great stay. Hotel staff all very pleasant,rooms clean,plenty of safe garage parking and great location. No complaints here at all. Great place to stay,keep up the good work!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Spend the Money”
Reviews.Author: healthstep
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed at many hotels and have seen the good, bad and ugly. At the last minute, we decided to to to OC but naturally had trouble finding any available hotels. However, we ended up at the Quality Inn Oceanfront. NEVER AGAIN. The staff was not cordial AT ALL and could care less if you were there; the hall carpets had nasty stains on ALL floors; the room carpet was nasty; the bathroom floor looked dirty like it had never been cleaned other than a quick sweep; the sofa was so dirty that we put a hotel sheet on it since it was so disgusting & the bathtub was so dirty that my wife refused to take a preferred bath and resorted to a shower. All in all, had the Hilton had space, I would have spent the extra money to stay there. Unless you do not care where you stay or are looking for a hotel that might be cheap (IN EVERY WAY), don't waste your money. Also, the furniture looks like it is out of the 70's. The outside looks nice BUT is quite deceitful as to the way it looks inside. I think this says it all!

Reviews.Title: “Nice view”
Reviews.Author: agustee54
Reviews.Content: Hotel was overall nice. The room was clean although outdated the kitchen had old appliances, but they worked. The oddest policy they had was the indoor pool was closed when there was lightning. There is little to do in Ocean City when it lightnings. The view was great from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Aging, but Gracefully”
Reviews.Author: lsb040
Reviews.Content: We've been staying at the Quality Inn Beachfront before the "suites" addition was built, so we remember it from the early, glory days. At the time, it was one of the few upscale hotels in OC, offering amenities not available at many others - like an indoor, heated pool and rooms with 1.5 bathrooms. Through the years, we saw the same staff at the front desk and they were all friendly, kind and helpful - and the service was personalized. The years have passed and they are still one of the nicer properties, but with the addition of a number of new hotels that were built on the sites of older hotels (that were torn down) - such as the Hilton Suites - that is where the Stardust was next door - Courtyard by Marriott (where the Santa Maria once was), the Holiday Inn & Suites, etc., they fall more into the category of upper level moderate or low level upscale. Overall, the Oceanfront rooms are very spacious, which is unusual in Ocean City. Other nice features in our room that you don't often find in OC were a full refrigerator and a stove/oven, as well as a microwave. The mattress was nice and firm and we loved the 2 person jaccuzi. The room was maintained in fairly good condition except for the woodwork at the bottom of the door, which was damaged and had a small opening to the outside (which was actually outside, due to the unusual location of our room). Our only real disappointment was that the service from the person who we first encountered at the front desk was one of those briskly officious types that are strictly by the book and not a square inch more. You all know the type - you can spot them by the look on their face. Since we were staying over the Memorial Day weekend and traffic from our area to the beach can be wicked, we'd left extremely early and had breakfast in Ocean City. Parking at the pay by hour lots were all full, so we had no choice but to see if we could register early to get a parking pass, planning to then go out on the beach until our room was ready. In the past, the great front desk people would take your cell phone number and call you when your room was available. We typically arrive early and the hotel wherever we've stayed would register us and then it would simply be a matter of giving us the room keys whenever the room was ready. During this process, they'd check to see if maybe the room WAS ready. Usually it wouldn't be, but most hotels will offer to take your cell phone # and will call you IF it's ready before check in time. Not this time. We were advised check-in is at 4:00 and there was no effort made to see if the room was ready. To her credit, she very efficiently and professionally issued us a parking pass and very accommodatingly provided us with a day pass that allowed us access to the indoor pool and the bathrooms located in that area. In fairness, it was Memorial Day weekend and they were most likely busy and it probably takes time to take the next step to calling the guest assigned to each room as the housekeepers relay the information on the rooms they finish. We left, went to lunch and returned to the hotel. On our way through to the beach, I noticed she wasn't at the front desk, so I stopped and asked another employee if he could check to see if by chance our room might be ready. He said he'd be happy to and we were delighted to learn it was, so we were able to check in and go to our room, change and go to the beach. I am very appreciative of professionalism and efficiently, but attitude is everything to me. I was fully prepared for our room not to be ready when we arrived, but I could tell the first gal I encountered was going to hold to the 4:00 check-in time even if every room in the hotel was ready - just because that's the policy. While this is such a small aspect of the overall stay, how you're treated at the front desk sets the tone for your whole stay. However, she was only one of several people working the front desk during our stay and the others were lovely. There's always one, isn't there? However, another experience with a different front desk person more than made up for any petty disappointment I had. On the second day of our stay, we had a death in the family and had to make an early departure. We were totally prepared to be charged for all 3 nights, even though we'd stayed only 1.5 days. As we checked out, my husband told the gentleman at the front desk that we had a family emergency and were checking out. He very kindly offered his sympathy and regret we had to cut short our visit and apologized that he had to charge us for two nights - as that was the minimum stay - but didn't charge us for the third night. We were totally surprised by this act of kindness, which will earn them our future business and recommendation of their hotel to all our friends and family. This was a classy act and we were touched and grateful for the courtesy extended to us at a difficult time. I wish I'd gotten his name, as he was extremely kind. In between our check in and departure, we had an embarassing moment. We returned from breakfast the second morning to hear the fire alarm sounding in our room. I quickly called the front desk to see if we needed to evacuate (we hadn't seen or smelled any smoke - and hotels will often have fire alarms go off) and were told they didn't see anything on their console, but she could hear it on the phone and they'd send someone right up. No kidding, but someone was there in less than 5 minutes. He walked right in, over to the clock radio - and turned off the alarm. We hadn't set the alarm, but apparently the prior guests had. Holy moly, but it was LOUD - and the very, very nice maintenance/engineer said it happens all the time. How humiliating, but what great service. Overall, I feel the hotel is a good value. You get a lot of nice amenities for a very reasonable price. The hotel may not have the very latest in decor, but it's been nicely maintained. It's also a few blocks up above the end of the boardwalk, so the location is quiet and we heard no noise from rooms on either side. Ideal for a family - nice for a couple. We'll return.

Reviews.Title: “Average - but would not stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: MsShay
Reviews.Content: I traveled with a party of 5 - 3 adults and 2 teens - and was specifically looking for a suite that would sleep all five of us comfortably. Last year we stayed at the Holiday Inn which was fabulous, but we were looking for a little less pricey alternative. Pros: Location - Amusement park only a couple of blocks away. There is a little deli on the same block that the kids could get to quickly. Also a McDonalds and Burger King just across the street. Two blocks to Higgins Crab House and only a couple of blocks to walk to tram that will take you down to the heart of the boardwalk. (Note - the kids missed being right on the boardwalk but this was a great alternative that they ended up quite happy with.) People - For as many issues that we had, the staff was quick to take care of each and every one and did so with a smile. One night desk employee didn't seem to know much about anything at all, but he sure was nice telling us how sorry he was. Parking - Ample parking in the 3 or 4 level garage. On site restaurant - Only open for breakfast. The omlettes were beautiful and service was great. Indoor Pool - Very roomy and clean. 3 separate showers to rinse off sand before entering the pool. Very nice hot tub, though often filled with children and a couple of the jets were borderline painful. Cons: Cleanliness - I really think this is one of the dirtiest hotels I've ever stayed in. The common areas were beautiful and very clean, but my room left a LOT to be desired. I couldn't even use the dish towels provided because of the dirt sticking to it from the drawer. The small in room coffee pot had mold growing around the top - stick to the free coffee provided in the lobby each morning. Age - The room just seemed run down. The sink was rotting out of the counter. The burners on the stove would not sit down flat. There isn't a SINGLE additional towel rack in the room. (They encourage reuse of towels but don't provide a place to hang them to dry. Odd.) Exposed carpet tacks brought blood to the heels of 3 of the 5 of us. These were fixed immediately. The hair dryer was literally cracked down the middle and threw sparks every 20 seconds or so. This, too, was replaced immediately. Room layout - Every suite I've ever stayed in has had two TVs. This is the first that had only one. The beds and the foldout couch are in one large living area. There is a strange accordian door that separated the fold out couch from the beds, but without a dedicated TV, I'm not really sure what the use of that might be. (Oh - and despite checking in with 5 people, there were no sheets, blankets or extra pillows for the fold out couch. That was ANOTHER call to the front desk.) Outdoor Pool - The outdoor pool is ocean view and on the 4th floor. There is an odd stone wall that sits in the middle of the deck that doesn't really appear to have a purpose. I'm sure it does - it's just very weird and blocks some of the view. There was only ONE table with a sun umbrella and the pool restroom was out of order. The manager, Matthew, was very apologetic about my experience here and handled my issues appropriately. I could possibly stay here again to give them another chance, but it is not likely.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: jra500
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the QI for the week of 7/11. Overall I would say just about everything was fine with our stay. The location is perfect and it is nice to have options for shopping and dining within walking distance. Like a few others have written our sofa did have some stains too but we just put the extra sheets provided on to cover it. (barely used it anyway) We loved to sit on the oceanfront private balcony and people watch when we were not enjoying the 2 pools or the ocean. This was our 3rd stay here in the past 4 years and we plan on coming back again next July!

Reviews.Title: “great staff terriable room”
Reviews.Author: doyouclean
Reviews.Content: First I would like to say the staff was friendly, but the room needed some cleaning. I stayed in suite 815. The door to the balcony was broken, could not lock, jacussi tube didn;t work,shower curtain had stains, mold around bathtube and the jets to the tube, floor was dirty, my lady had to lay towels down because she was so disgusted by the floor. The shower and restroom by the outdoor pool was out of service. I could go on and on. I probably would have left i wanted to spend my days looking for another room

Reviews.Title: “Deplorable-FIRE ALARM in our ROOM 530AM NO RESPONSE AT DESK”
Reviews.Author: vjtimko
Reviews.Content: 6/30-7/4/11 Wouldn't book my dog there! First room was booked incorrectly & to small, staff kindly relocated us to only open room big enough & it was smoking- gross. HUGE stains on bed skirt, chair and sleeper sofa. I covered with extra sheets after spraying Lysol thoroughly so we could sit on them. Beds were HORRIBLE 2 dbl beds both my husband and I woke with pins and needles in our arms from the springs poking all night. Of course I brought my own pillows and blankets and tossed the top cover in the closet immediately. Hair dryer was torn off of the wall. Leaving wallpaper torn and bare plaster with holes showing. A replacement hair dryer was in the vanity. Ceiling tile in bathroom fell in every time we opened the bathroom door & yes, it was moldy. Rotted wood and rusted nails trimmed the floorboards to the sliding glass-doors to the balcony that overlooked a EMPTY outdoor pool with half torn off cover blowing in the wind. Fungus growing around indoor jacuzzi- GROSS. Restrooms and shower to outdoor pool closed off with tape and paper sign. Third floor doors not secured. Key pass wouldn't work for us & other couple on 2nd floor asked for maintenance and they were off duty for the night (4th of July weekend). THE BEST FOR LAST: Woke to smoke detector going off at 530am in our room (we don't smoke & were sleeping never used oven or stove) called the desk MULTIPLE times no answer, my husband went to the desk no one there just a sign said be back ten min. We called again NO ANSWER. He took the smoke detector of of the wall must have been lose wire, LUCKILY no fire & our 3& 6 year old slept through it! You get what you pay for! And our impromptu weekend certainly rang true to this! Never again! Oh and they told us doors were open to come in and out of until 5pm from the beach- GUESS WHAT they locked them but never posted a note families with children needed to go to the restroom found out the hard way with a long walk to the other doors! PS. ONLY ONE ICE MAKER for the six floors! IF you ask the desk to recommend a local pizza shop they tell you Papa Johns (HELLO, that is a chain - useless). The lobby is very deceiving.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times”
Reviews.Author: sweets89
Reviews.Content: Room was very spacious. The ocean view was breathtaking. There was a fly problem, but it eventually was resolved. The furniture was somewhat outdated but comfy. Decent price, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good value for OC, MD”
Reviews.Author: krismsulli
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Ocean City for the Ward Competition at the convention center, which was a 10 min. walk from the hotel. The location is great of this place - right on the beach (but not on the boardwalk), close to a few bars and restaurants, etc. If you're looking for all the boardwalk action, though, that part is missing. The staff were nice enough, parking was in a garage on site, and overall the experience was good. We had a king bed jacuzzi room with a balcony that overlooked a side street. The room had a kitchenette, dining table, and love seat. Everything looked dated and it could use a good deep cleaning, but wasn't too bad. I feel kind of "meh" about the look of the room, but the features were really convenient and the in-room jacuzzi was fun (there's a separate standing shower too). There is also a jacuzzi by the pool, which is near a pretty decent workout room

Reviews.Title: “"Fantastic Room"”
Reviews.Author: drob1121
Reviews.Content: Just getting around to writing this review, but my wife and I really enjoyed our stay here. I've been visiting OCMD since my childhood and continue to come down atleast 3 times a year as a couple and/or with my kids. We usually like to book rooms on the boardwalk but I was always curious about this particular Quality Inn after staying at the Quality Inn Boardwalk on several occasions. We stayed in a Presidential Suite which was a corner room. The room was huge and the balcony wrapped around the side of the building. We were so impressed with our view that we spent hours out there even though it was bit chilly. The beds were comfortable and we really enjoyed the flat screen television in both rooms. I really enjoyed my stay here and I also appreciated that the hotel personally packaged a camera charger that I had accidentaly left behind and saved it until I was visiting the area on Memorial Day weekend. I can't wait to bring our kids down to enjoy the spacious room, balcony, and pool.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING BEST HOTEL EVER”
Reviews.Author: miki52486
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. I don't know why anyone would stay anywhere else. The room was large and very clean. The view was beautiful and the 2 person jacuzzi was just the best. It was the most relaxing vacation ever and everyone was really friendly. I can't speak highly enough of this hotel. Completely wonderful from start to finish. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “What a DUMP - filthy beyond belief!!”
Reviews.Author: scott-joy
Reviews.Content: My husband, 5 month old son and myself arrived late on a Friday night and had no idea how bad the room was until the next day. We were given a pack and play with regular sheets for our 5 month old to sleep in - suffication hazard. The pack and play was stained beyond belief. Our son slept in his nap nanny. The tub was stained black in the bottom and mold was growing all over. The coffee pot had not been cleaned and had residue in the bottom and the old coffee pouch was still in the maker! The carpet had ground in gum and was buckling throughout the room. There was a terrible smell on the second floor by the parkeing garage and the ceiling was begining to cave in. What a mess and never again!! ho

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: johnskibum
Reviews.Content: On the beach, Great staff ] Does need some furniture upgrades, But It didn`t matter that much, we spent a lot of time sightseeing. Seacrets Tiki bar on 49th st. oceanic blvd , was a blast. The bus will take you there For $ 1.00 .Attn; Fisherman The Ocean Princess . Deep Sea Charter was Great, I saw a seal , and caught the most fish. [410-289-6226]

Reviews.Title: “Ugly Room - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: RonDeeVouz
Reviews.Content: I went thru Hotels.com to secure my girls getaway lodging this weekend, and I have a feeling that internet discounts get the worst rooms. The suite was nothing to write home about, the refrigerator looked like someone had beat the door with a baseball bat, and the little studio size stove was broken. I cooked a pizza at the instructed temperature and it was black and setting off the fire alarm halfway thru the cooking time. But overall I would stay there again. The staff was pleasant, the pool area was clean and well maintained. Some older hotels you have to worry about mildew smells and poorly maintained facilities, but this hotel had none of those problems. The breakfast we had at the hotel's restaurant was great, with the sweetest waitress that was 82 years old! I wanted to put her in my pocket and take her home with me. Very pleasant staff.

Reviews.Title: “amazing service and wonderful workers!”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Cooper_1213
Reviews.Content: my husband and I stayed in this hotel for a little while, when he was working in the area. our daughter was under 2 at the time and everyone loved her, we got to know a lot of the employees and they are just amazing! always helpful and always smiling! Our room was the perfect size for the three of us, and it was so clean! they take good care of you here! The resturants food was delicious! I would most definately recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Clean Hotel!!!!!!!:)”
Reviews.Author: MRSDAVIS34
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our anniversary weekend. This hotel was very clean in a nice location. Anyone with doubts give this hotel a try you won't be sorry the rates were amazing. Will be returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kate_the_Dispatcher
Reviews.Content: I had first heard about the Quality Inn Beachfront from a relative who had just returned from there. Needing a get-away of my own, I went online and selected the perfact room for myself. For 59.99, I got an Oceanview room with a wirlpool bathtub and make shift kitchen close to the boardwalk. We arrived around 4pm and were greeted by the kind hotel staff. They told us how late the pool was open and about breakfast and that we could get a cupon in the morning. Because there wasnt a Sunsations open, I was unable to get a swimsuit to go in the pool, but it looked nice from what I saw. The room was wonderful!! We were able to drive up into this garage and park right outside the door to our floor. The beds were comfortable and the next morning we got to see the sun come up over the ocean. I will definately return, and I may even consider paying a little extra to return when its warmer.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it -- just 1 small issue”
Reviews.Author: MDBarbara
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel was terrific! Super friendly and helpful! The pool was fantastic. The restaurant was ok and reasonably priced. The location is surperb! While our room was dated and a little worn (what beach hotel room isn't a little worn) it was clean and certainly met our needs. The only issue was that the person before us left the old sheets wadded up in the sofa bed, but we made management aware and it was correctly immediately. I will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “DUMP”
Reviews.Author: Shellyboo70
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, this Quality Inn is very deceiving. The bathrooms, furnishing, carpets and room decor, are from the 80's. and the establishment is COVERED in water stains, rust, mildew and MOLD. There was no place for us to go.... we demanded another room and got it... The difference was like night and day. The new bathroom was up to date, but still had rust. But, there was not mildew or mold.... That we could see. I would never ever stay here again. As my friend told the clueless night manager " There is no quality at the Quality INN"

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: JimS293
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the owners suite outstanding views outstandinmg rooms great service

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Holesy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our first trip to OC for an end-of-summer trip. Based on the prior reviews, we were a little apprehensive about this hotel, but were pleasantly surprised. We had an oceanfront suite with a great balcony. The location is outstanding as you can walk 100' from the hotel onto the beach. You are also outside of the boardwalk area, but certainly within walking distance. The covered garage is great because you can park on the floor where your room is located, making it very quick and easy to access your car. Also, although breakfast is not included in the price like other Choice Hotels, the restaurant was extremely nice with quick service and very reasonable prices. The room furnishings were a bit old and out of date, but we found the rooms to be clean, spacious, and the beds to be very comfortable. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: JW75
Reviews.Content: Wasnt to sure about this place with some of the reviews on here,but it was a good expierence,staff was nice,parking was great and safe,room was roomy,bed was comfy,good location,elevators fast,provate balcony was great,with a great view,Id def stay there again. Only bad deal was alarm for hotel went off mid day,but heard some1 walked out wrong deal,not hotel fault. Not a bad place at all!!

Reviews.Title: “very rude front desk help”
Reviews.Author: judyruggs57
Reviews.Content: i was trying to make a reservation for my stay in september. i called a very nice young lady who quoted me a price at 2;230pm on august 15th. i had to wait for my husband to come home to talk it over with him. when he came home i called back and she was gone but another young lady answered the phone. when i told her the lady and the price i was quoted she said that she would not be comfortable dong that price. she also proceeded to tell me that she has quoted people that price before but she was not comfortable honoring the price i had recieved about two hours ago. she said i would have to walk in off the street to get this price. i tried to call back but unfortunately i had missed the origional lady. i had the pleasure of speaking to. unfortunately i had the pleasure of dealing with the same rude obnoxious lady who told me to call the general manger towmarrow and take it up with him. . what i do not understand is how you can be quoted one price and 2 hours later they would not honor it. i would love to have tried this hotel but i guess if the staff is that rude maybe some other hotel would appreciate my business.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: TEA-fun-in-the-sun
Reviews.Content: A little too overpriced; However, it was Peak-Season. Large room. Comfy beds. Friendly check-in agent. Ample parking. The view is SPECTACULAR! Nice pools. Far from noisy crowds and heavy traffic, yet close enough to shops, amusement, excursions, restaurants and rentals. I just wish it wasn't so expensive so we could spend more time there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: MRTS33
Reviews.Content: This place was GREAT! On the beach, indoor and outdoor pool, hot tub, sauna. My family and I had a suite because we don't like feeling cramped. Parking in a garge was nice not to have to get in a hot car when we went out. There was plenty to do within walking distance if you didn't want to drive. The end of the board walk is like 6 blocks away. We were on the beach everyday and saw dolphins everyday we were there. Friendly people and staff made our trip VERY ENJOYABLE!!!!! Can't wait for next summer. The only bad thing was having to go home.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay on the beach”
Reviews.Author: apfern
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a quick 3 day trip to the beach. Kids loved the outdoor pool, husband loved having coffee on the patio overlooking the beach. Location is great; overlooking beach and within walking distance to Jolly Roger amusements, not too far from the boardwalk. The hotel is clearly a little older than the brand new Hilton next door, but well maintained and for half the price of the Hilton, it was just what we needed! Pros: Location, price. Cons: High speed internet was slow and parking garage was tight.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: M0M0F4B0YS
Reviews.Content: Our huge family stayed again since we had such a great time last year. We booked 5 rooms. The hotel staff is great. Everyone smiles and says hello and takes care of everything you need. The day we arrived it was pouring down rain. We left early thinking we would get there and spend most of the day on the boardwalk before checking in. Needless to say, that plan was ruined by the storm. We explained to the wonderful lady at the front desk that we had 10 kids with us and we were all soaked and miserable. She gave us a key to the pool until we could get our rooms. As they became available, we checked in. This hotel is very family friendly and accommodating. It is close to lots of attractions. There is a deli next door that sells everything you need. Golf and laser tag right across the street. Perfect! Thanks again for a great vacation. See you next year!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: ktip35
Reviews.Content: Its a fabulous hotel to stay at! The service was great they couldn't help you enough. The location, right on the beach, what more could you ask for. I can't wait till next year to go back!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful relaxed weekend.”
Reviews.Author: rsndu
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Not crowded like the ones on boardwalk. Beach is in the front. Enough parking. Very quiet and clean. Pool is good. We had 2 young kids ages 3 and 2. Adventure park is 3 blocks away. Boardwalk is 6 blocks away. Restaurant on site with good breakfast menu at reasonable price. But compared to the overall service and amenities, can't be a better deal.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Good Deal for Family who wants Oceanfront”
Reviews.Author: MomofthreeMonroe_Nj
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a great time in OC,MD!!! . We booked a VERY last minute vacation, and for a family of 5, we needed a larger room on the ocean. We did get that. The Views from our private balcony were magnificent! Being steps from the beach made it SO easy with the 3 kids. However, room was clean, but definitely dated, very 80's. The 1 1/2 bath worked out GREAT! Kitchenette scared me at first , but I used my lysol wipes before I prepared any lunches. Beds were comfy , and kids were ok on sofa bed. Very spacious. Roof top pool was quiet and clean, but the bathroom up there needed to be condemmed!!!! Sheet rock was all over floor and it smelled of rotten paint and mildew! I don't think they even clean it!!!! It was NASTY!!!! Indoor pool was dated as well, and water was very cloudy. Bathroom there was newer but also huge hole in ceiling with mold and dripping pipes ( that is the bath you need to use off beach). Overall , we think it was a fair price for a "beachy ' hotel. Most likely would go back ( now we know what to expect) , if I couldn't get a better deal next door at the Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Money Well Spent”
Reviews.Author: Tytay
Reviews.Content: Just spent a pleasant long weekend at this hotel. Check-in was easy and fairly quick. Our room was non-smoking but upon entering had a strong smoke smell. Called front desk and someone was sent up quickly to remove the smell. Wasn't convinced this would work but was pleasantly surprised when we got back to the room and the odor was virtually eliminated. Pool was great - 8 ft which is not typical for many of the OC hotels we've stayed in. Pool was also very clean with private whirlpool. Room was decent enough - typical beach hotel. The bathroom did have some mildew on the shower walls and there was a bit of mold around the shower area. I zapped it with cleaner and moved along. I asked the cleaning person if there was a broom I could use for the bathroom area to keep sand at minimum and she provided one. Daily cleaning/straightening was good with extra towels provided without a hassle. The 33rd St location was close enough to the Boardwalk to get there pretty quickly and far enough away to lessen the beach traffic. Parking deck was wonderful with access to the hotel directly from the second floor. Plenty of spaces and nice to have the car out of the hot sun.
