Reviews.Title: “Once Again, Requests Not Honored Due to Not Paying Full Price.”
Reviews.Author: sigmagrrl
Reviews.Content: I'm so disheartened that hotels view Priceline and Hotwire customers as throwaway customers. We're revenue you otherwise wouldn't have had (empty rooms = REVPAR you will never get back!) and I don't appreciate being given the worst available room simply because YOU chose to give us a room at a lower rate. Not my idea of customer service. Please do not automatically assign internet reservations to "smoking double" rooms. That's not what most people want. Don't block the room if there is inventory available. Ask us when we get there! Anyway, on to the hotel. WOW, this place needed a facelift YESTERDAY! The walls and ceiling tiles were stained/cracked/chipped/missing. The bathrooms are LAME! The little sitting area felt cramped, and the furniture looked like they chose the cheapest pieces possible! I felt like I was in a hospital room, not a hotel room! The balconies are the weirdest I've ever seen. A little gate separates your balcony from a larger balcony that's shared with others. HUH? I used the pool area early in the AM and it was ok. It was dead and kid-free thank goodness, so I was able to just enjoy it for what it was: a place to soak/escape. Parking is free, which is a help, but fills up quickly. I do enjoy the convenience of coming into your room's floor from the parking deck...IF parking is available. I won't stay here again unless it's an emergency. I felt they just didn't meet some standards that are important to me. Maybe it'll please others.

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay, little pricey for what we got...”
Reviews.Author: kc-bug
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I stayed here last weekend for a one-night getaway. Overall average hotel, but pricey for what we got. Check-in went fine. Plenty of parking in garage. Rooms are pretty late 80s-early 90s and could use overhauls. We had a suite, which was nice and roomy, but there's pale blue/purple wallpaper with clouds (???). Tiny kitchenette that we never used; glad we weren't staying but for one night. Extremely clean bathroom. Beds were nice (I checked for bedbugs!) and seemed new. Nice thick curtains to keep the lights out in the morning. Overall very average hotel. Clean, safe, but a lot of 'extras' for the money we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Spend the extra money and stay at a 3 or 4 star hotel...awful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: marc_3000
Reviews.Content: The only positive...the staff was pleasant. For the extra $60-80 dollars go stay at the Hilton next door. Pool looked and smelled dirty, blue tile flooring all over. Sofa's, beds, dressers, tables, kitchen and the lighting looked as they were 40-50 years old. The carpet had an ungodly old musty smell (older lady neighbor who lives with 33 cats comes to mind). Microwave broken, the list goes on...if you're into the trailer park demographics then you would feel quite at home, on the other hand if you prefer newer accommodations, cleaner facilities, a bar that is actually open then reserve a room at the Mariott or Hilton because that is where you will end up having your nightcap anyway.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST hotel in Ocean City HANDS DOWN!”
Reviews.Author: BCEPHROCKZ
Reviews.Content: Once I found out I got Vacation time in March I immediately call the Quality Inn Beachfront in Ocean city to book my weeks stay. After an outstanding time the previous year in July me and my wife along with our two children had no other choice but to come back! This time it was even better, with great weather and sunsets right from our room we could not have asked for more. The staff could not be anymore friendly and genuine with our daily needs. I'm looking forward to our next trip to OC and the Quality Inn. I would also recommend everyone to enjoy the great services me and my family did during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Have returned 2 years in a row & have enjoyed it each time!”
Reviews.Author: Trisch61
Reviews.Content: We like the location of the hotel and really loved our room this past year!! First floor, right next to the beach access! Had a great time and the room was quite comfortable. The service we had with housekeeping was nice. The staff was accomodating to all our requests. The pool and hot tub were great and the top floor of the hotel was great to sit and chat. Can't wait to get down there again this fall for winefest, and stay at Quality Inn beachfront @ 33rd street!! My great friends and I hope we can get the same room again!! Hope you can help us out with this!! It was room 110! :-).

Reviews.Title: “Very clean hotel and in a great location!! You never disappoint me Quality Inn Beachfront! :)”
Reviews.Author: holiday17
Reviews.Content: The Quality Inn Beachfront located at 33rd Street & Oceanfront is one of THE best hotels in Ocean City. I have stayed at many other hotels in OC for vacation, but nothing stands a chance against this property! Clean rooms, prime oceanfront views, prompt and courteous staff! The hotel boasts an on-site restaurant serving a wide variety of items for breakfast! I especially enjoyed the French Toast! It was a great way to start off the morning! Whenever we needed an extra pillow or bath towels, housekeeping was right on the money! Sunburst Hospitality is doing a superb job with this hotel! I am very surprised with how the lobby was clean! No sand or anything! Spotless! I am best friends with the owner of the Quality Inn Beachfront's neighbors and I see how hard it is to keep a beachfront hotel clean (esp. with all the sand on the floor) because she tells me what a bear it is to keep the Lobby debris free of sand and how rough the building is to keep clean from the constant salt air given by the ocean. Keep up the excellent work, Quality Inn Beachfront!!!

Reviews.Title: “It was ok.”
Reviews.Author: stormgirl071
Reviews.Content: The location was fairly good, would have been nice to be close to the boardwalk, but was nice and quiet and pretty private. Check in and out went fairly quick and staff was nice and friendly. The hotel itself is very dated and has seen better days. The room was very big, had a kitchen, which we didn't need but nice if you are staying for days and have kids. The bathroom needed updating, and was dirty in the corners and had hairs on the floor. Was kind of pricey, but like I said the room was very big!! We were there only for one night so not too bad, I don't know if I would stay there again though.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Renovations!”
Reviews.Author: PUM1966
Reviews.Content: Rooms in desperate need of renovations, ceiling tiles falling off in bathroom, also wood on vanity's chipped and broken, stains on carpet. However, staff was accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff / Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MGB8881
Reviews.Content: Drove into town a bit early and had no trouble checking in. Pools and hot-tub were clean as was our room. Nice to have an affordable restaurant in the hotel even if it only served breakfast. Couldn't get any closer to the beach. Friendly & helpful staff. Would definitely recommend for couples or a family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “ok stay poor restaurant service”
Reviews.Author: vacation75
Reviews.Content: we stayed in august of 09 the room was ok nice pool the bathrooms need upgrading the outside bar was ok limited outside bar menu and the restaurant was less up to par we wanted room service because of our handicapped daughter but you couldnt get it limited help on laborday weekend so my husband went down to order and bring breakfast to the room nada!!! no standing orders tisk tisk wont stay again! the restaurant is leased but still the hotel shoiuld have a say in the restaurant service it reflects on the hotel!!! we'll find another hotel one reason we stayed there because of the onsite restaurant. also the drapes in the room where sheer morning light came in we like to sleep with it a bit darker!!

Reviews.Title: “Another nice stay!!”
Reviews.Author: jra500
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Ocean City and had another nice stay at the QI on 33rd st. Oceanfront room was again much cleaner than any other hotels we have tried in OC and the location can't be beat. Not ON the boardwalk with all the traffic and noise but just a short walk FROM the boardwalk. Plus many restaurants and shopping within walking distance. Only slight annoinance this time was the maid service's erractic schedule. Some days they were there while we were just getting up (9:30) and other days they came at 3:30. While I don't expect an appointment it would be nice if they were more consistant with their times and came within a 90 minute window of time every day.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: M0M0F4B0YS
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights. There were 18 of us including 11 kids, ages 13, 12 10, 7, 7, 6, 6, 4, 2, 2 and 5 months. It was perfect for all ages. The hotel staff was excellent and very helpful. We stayed on the second floor and had ocean front rooms. The rooms were enourmous which gave all the kids plenty of room to do whatever. I highly recommend this hotel to families. The location is great. You are close enough to everything but yet far enough away from the crowds. We were able to walk across the street to golf and there is a store right behind the hotel for food, drinks, snacks, etc. I was leary about some of the reviews but I honestly don't have anything bad to say. We will be booking our rooms for next year as soon as the system allows us!

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money, outdated, and run down....dump”
Reviews.Author: msbart
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here Aug. 3-7. We have stayed here in the past and were always happy. Not this time. The new ownership/management leaves alot to be desired. Upon check in we were greeted by a very rude desk clerk. Our room was large and oceanfront. But that was all, as it was very, very outdated and run down. Peeling wallpaper, rusty doors, old t.v. and t..v. stand was falling apart. Black hideous 1980's wallpaper everywhere, cruddy corroded faucets in bathrrom and especially the kitchen. The whirlpool jets in the tub were disgusting. The furniture was sticky to touch, and the room was supposed to be non smoking and it reaked with smoke. The floor below us was designated non-smoking, but the guy in the room below us smoked cigars day and night on his balcony which ended up on our balcony. On our second day we had no maid service. When I called the front desk the person was arrogant, rude and down right nasty like it was my fault that the maids didn't clean the rooms. Two hours later, they sent someone from housekeeping up with some "towels". The room was never serviced that day, and no discount in the rate was even offered by the hotel staff. Now oceanfront rooms are expensive, and I don't mind paying for them, but I really do think that for the price they charge they can at least have someone make up the bed & take away the dirty towels. The hallways in the building were hot and musty all the time. They whole place seemed dirty and unkept. Last year I stayed at the Hilton next door to this place, and believe me I will go back there again and pay extra just to have a nice place to stay, and nice people at check in and out. This place has become a dump....the new ownership/management is terrible. Do youself a favor and don't stay here, not even one night....There are much better places for the same or less money.

Reviews.Title: “PLEASE READ! EXPERIENCED WITH THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: VacationReviewer999
Reviews.Content: This hotel review will answer most of your convictions about this hotel. The first thing you need to know when booking at this hotel is that there are two parts to this hotel, one is much cleaner and all around better than the other. You can probably see that people have left bad reviews, mostly because they got stuck with the poor rooms. This is the third time in the last four years that my family has stayed at this hotel. Here is what I recommend for booking the hotel: 1. Call into the hotel early. You don't want to be stuck with limited choices. 2. Ask for a room on the inside third or fourth floors. You dollar goes furthest on these two floors. I specify inside because there is a portion of the hotel where you would have to go up the elevator and then walk outdoors to get to your room. The rooms here are in much worse shape. We were stuck with room 402 two years ago. 3. If you have a whole family of 4 with you, try to get a corner room. We got room 410 four years ago and loved it so much that we called this year to reserve that very room. The corner rooms are significantly larger that the average room, have two toilets and two sinks, along with a cozy breakfast nook. Okay, now it's time for the review. For a two-star hotel, it's rather nice. Again, our room review comes from #410, so please be aware of this. From the broad perspective, the room is pleasant. Upon the entrance is the breakfast nook that is next to the kitchen, which is situated against the wall opposite the door. Across from the kitchen is that bathroom sink with the toilet and full bath on either side of it. Down further are the beds, which seem fresh and clean. At the very end of the room is the living area with a decent tv. If you're used to HD flat screen, this will seem like the stone age, but for me, it worked fine. The balcony has a great view of the ocean, and circles around the room for a view of the bay side. If you weren't looking for flaws, then you probably wouldn't find them. But a closer look, one would noticed the out-dated appliance of the 1980-90's era. The wallpaper has scuff markings on it, and the bathroom door is chipped at the bottom. These things are nitpicky, but remember that you can't be too critical with a hotel. The staff seems to be friendly. The maids do an acceptable job. It upsets me to see the stuff they have to deal with. During our stay, someone had dropped dead hermit crabs all over the hallways. However, the hotel responded quickly by bringing in Stanley Steamer to clean the carpets. The hotel has two pools, one indoor, one outdoor. The indoor pool is probably the nicest in ocean city, with depths starting at 3' and going down to 8'. The indoor area also has a hot tub and sauna. The outdoor pool is much more kid-friendly, with depths of 3' to 4'. Other features of the hotel is an arcade, which has about ten different arcade-style games, and a pay-to-play pool table. The fitness room is disappointing, with only stairmasters and a treadmill. A useful feature of this hotel is the laundry room, so you won't have to do as much laundry when you go home. The hotel has a restaurant with a la carte menus. Hope this helps. I recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a nice hotel on the beach for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Wayland is the best general manager”
Reviews.Author: kolijah
Reviews.Content: Not that I am prejudiced, but I have known Wayland since the Old Town Holiday Inn experience. An old friend and lost touch.

Reviews.Title: “Barebones Accomodation by the Sea”
Reviews.Author: lomtevas
Reviews.Content: We were quite unimpressed with QISB [--]Ocean City, MD. We occupied a suite on the sixth floor at a rate in excess of $200 per night. We were astonished at the lack of any service or amenities. It appeared as if the hotel was importing cheap Russian labor as “student exchanges” in order to cut costs. However, we saw no one monitoring the two pools in the building. The only security was the use of a room key to gain entry. We saw room service diminished to the point that we had to go around asking for extra coffee packs and shampoo bottles. There was no complementary breakfast. There was only one ice machine on the first floor. Our suite had an enormous outside porch for sunbathing and gathering. The railing appeared as if it was previously damaged: it appears as if it is pushed outward and bent. The photo reveals its appearance and there appear to be repaired cracks in the concrete. This presented another safety hazard to anyone caught leaning to see the ocean. Hence, the porch was unusable. The fixtures in the rooms were opulent until one looked into the details. The beds were too small and the fold open sofa was uncomfortable. Glass tubed television sets were present as was a kitchenette with a defective stove. There is bedding for four in the suite but the coffee maker drips out only four cups at a time. The bathroom is also opulent but the commode’s pull chain broke necessitating a visit from maintenance. Internet was offered as free wireless but rarely worked. We had to contact “ethostream” to learn that there was a router error in the building causing the system to fail to connect to the internet. A low signal back up worked but caused internet connections to be unreliable. This is a decent place catering to up scale clientele. The core is solid but it is clear that the recession has taken its toll. It’s a Quality Inn with de minimus outlay for expenses and the price was too high for the overall accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: brucef1960
Reviews.Content: spent four nights here..room was dirty found soda can under bed first day left it there to see what would hapen still there day 4 poor house keeping.. stayed on third floor hallway smelled and room smelled..vanity in bathroom was moldy and rotted. dried food on wall and around stove in kitchen..furniture looked like it was bought at flea market..rooms need updated i asked the house keeper if all the rooms were like this..all she said was' 'you need room clean.''.other words she did not understand english..would have asked for another room but figured they were all the same..if you have ever stayed in a hotel with any class you will not like it here. not worth $1100.00 for four nights

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EVER!!! PICTURES LIE”
Reviews.Author: udstracy
Reviews.Content: We stayed her the week of Memorial Day. We entered our room, large but very dated and FILTHY! The bathroom was moldy , there was someones HAIR still in the storage drawers, there were stains on the tables and the bedspreads. We tried to go complain at the desk only to find that our door wouldn't lock! I went to complain, the lady at the desk was pleasant sent someone to fix the door ( waited an hour!) and later someone to try and clean better, explaining the dirt by saying they had been booked the night before? After the maintenance man fixed the door, we went down to the heated pool and hot tub with the waterfall. WELL... Pool was COLD and really cloudy, I wouldn't even get it . The hot tub had ANTS crawling all over the place, the waterfall didn't work and when the jets came on there was dirty foam 12 inches thick! Again went to the front desk ...again very polite telling me that the pool was cold because it was cold out ?( HEATED by the sun is what they meant I guess?) and that ants were no big deal she gets them at her house too!!! ( RAID works wonders!!) Checked next day an apparently they didnt have a can because they were there our whole stay. OK all this in our first 2 hours!! come nighttime there was a storm, scaffolding banged against the building all night long!! Must have been banging hard too, because when we got up in the AM a piece of molding was off the wall and on our bed!!! Again with the front desk and the maintenance guy!!! Said the outside was being painted and nothing they could do about the banging , which woke us up EVERYDAY!!! Wrote all of the above on my quality survey that I found waiting in my email, haven't heard 1 word from anyone! We go away to relax in the pool and catch up on sleep , couldn't do either here! Worst experience ever and we have stayed in OC almost every year since the early 90's!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great view, not so crazy about city...”
Reviews.Author: funshine13
Reviews.Content: Our hotel was nice! We had a balcony with a perfect view of the beach, small kitchen area w/ real dishes and dishwasher, fridge, kitchen table, etc. Our room was huge and a large, nice bathroom, too. Everything was nice. Nothing fancy, just nice. and was clean! Nice indoor and outdoor pools, too. Good distance from boardwalk. (away from rowdiness?) A short drive to Assateague Island (wild horses.) On the other hand, though the city was clean and with a lot of choices for mini golf, go karts, it was TOTALLY overan by COLLEGE KIDS!!!! Drunk, driving fast, noisy, etc. I did not notice any of this on our beach or our hotel but the minute you stepped out streetside it was bad. Maybe go at another time while students are in school???

Reviews.Title: “Way better than I had expected!”
Reviews.Author: theycallmemom
Reviews.Content: I went to OC in February 2008 as a last minute getaway with my husband and daughter. When we finally arrived in OC, it was quite late(about 8 at night), and we were looking for a place to stay. My husband and I decided to see if the Quality Inn Beachfront had any rooms available. They did, and we checked in and went up to our room. It was way better than I expected it to be! We had booked a suite, and we had a bath and a half, a kitchenette, a large closet, two beds, a couch, coffee table, and tv, and a balcony. The whole room was very spacious and nice. We only had to ask for extra pillows/towels, but the maids were cheery and delivered them to us right away. The refrigerator made it convienent to store food & drinks in so they wouldn't spoil. While we stayed at the Quality Inn Beachfront, they were doing construction so it was kind of noisy, and the saw dust made the fire alarm go off a couple of times so we did have to evacuate the building, but those two things were my only complaints. Overall, I had a great experience at the Quality Inn Beachfront and plan on staying at the Quality Inn Boardwalk this summer to see if thats as good. I would definetly recommend this hotel to anyone that was looking for a place to stay in OC!

Reviews.Title: “It just doesn't get any better.....”
Reviews.Author: Geibel49
Reviews.Content: I just can't say enough about this place. We have been coming there for over 15 years and I am very particular about where I stay because I'm a homebody at heart. We only go away about twice a year and I feel at home at the Quality Inn Beachfront. Last year we decided to try an upscale hotel thinking we would enjoy the change and we ended up leaving there and going right back to familiar territory. This hotel has everything we need. We're country people so being in the city can sometimes be a litle suffocating to us but once we sit on our deck and see that beautiful ocean, all the stress melts away and we're back in our own little peaceful surroundings. The staff is wonderful and accomodating and it's clean. Another plus is Anthony's hoagies, they can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “My stay was a wonderful surprise”
Reviews.Author: beachl0ver09
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ocean City Quality Inn at 5400 Coasta Highway for several nights -- it was a last minute getaway and I wanted to be away from the Boardwalk area. All of the staff was wonderful, friendly and helpful. And special kudos to Donna Richards, the front desk manager. She helped me out and made me feel welcome and at home. I hadn't expected much - but the room was nicely equipped, clean and right overlooking the ocean -- what a view from my room. I will definitely be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Large Room for Families”
Reviews.Author: Trishmae
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Quality Inn Beachfront over the Easter Weekend. The room was very spacious and the 4th floor ocean view from the balcony was fantastic. It was only my husband and myself, but if you're traveling with kids you will really appreciate the extra half-bath. The room is also much larger than most hotel efficiences. The rooms are a bit oudated. The kitchen applicances need to be replaced. The sofa was also very worn. However, the room was very clean and the beds and bedding were very comfortable. I was disappointed that the room did not have a DVD player. We had to purchase a portable DVD player to watch the movies we brought. We did not use the indoor swimming pool, but it looked very clean and inviting. The only other disappointment was that the bar/lounge was not open on weekends during the off-season.

Reviews.Title: “Solid older hotel for families or couples; quiet in the off-season”
Reviews.Author: Mia_My_O
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfect for the off-season... not too crowded and quiet for a weekend getaway. I'm not sure that I would return in the height of the season though. The pool and hot tub offered a great relaxation tool. The room itself was spacious and satisfactorily clean. The hotel seemed to go out of its way to provide what you'd need for a night or a week's stay. When we checked in, it was about 20 minutes before their check in time. The couple in front of us walked in off the street and got a room immediately. (We had reserved ours through priceline.) We were told that the room was not ready and to check back in 20 or so minutes. I wanted to go ahead and park the car on the corresponding level where I room was located since I had a cast on my foot and mobility was limited. They told me that they could not tell me what floor I'd be on. Which made no sense: our room is not ready, but you cannot tell us what room we're in, yet the couple who walked in off the street were checked in immediately. Hmmmm. That was fishy.

Reviews.Title: “All Ocean Front Rooms Non Smoking”
Reviews.Author: FeathersandBlooms
Reviews.Content: I just found out that all of the oceanfront rooms are now non smoking, but rooms without a view are.I recently stayed in a room in October and yes it was Oceanfront and yes it was smoking.I spent over $900.00 for my stay.I called to make reservations again and this a shock to find this out. I have stayed here for over 25 years! and now my money is not as good as a non smokers..That is...(Only Without a View)This is so not right and Quality Inn 33rd Street has now lost my business along with others in my Family.

Reviews.Title: “Fit the bill for off season holiday escape”
Reviews.Author: smokemon
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Ocean City and stayed at this hotel from 12/14-12/26. Wanted to escape for the Christmas holiday and got a rate of $43.00 per night for a standard King room by booking through an airline for the 250 mile bonus. We called the hotel twice before we booked and found the gentleman we talked to to be very helpful, and pleasant in answering our questions. Since we were staying during Christmas, we knew that dining in the area would be limited. When we arrived, the gentleman at the desk had hand written the hours of some local restaurants on paper and had it copied for the guests. He was just as pleasant in person greeting us upon our arrival. There were no area maps available, so on Christmas day the woman at the front desk wrote directions to Assateague Island for us. Being that the hotel was empty, check-in was a breeze. Our king room was on the 6th floor facing the street, with a partial view of the ocean and good view of the bay. The room had a refridge, coffee machine, dishwasher, hair dryer, small table w/2 chairs, stove and one upholstered chair in the corner. Also a balcony w/table and chairs. Big TV with plenty of basic cable channels. The bed was comfy, but the pillows were not. If you're a two pillow person, better stick to one in this hotel or face a stiff neck in the morning. Had a problem with the heat not working, and as we discussed calling the front desk, a maintenance worker arrived at our door and had it working in 2 minutes. Seemed that it was hooked up to a central system which detected faults. Although we didn't partake, the indoor pool and area seemed very clean. It was located in an atrium area with plenty of daylight. The games room had a few pinball machines, among other games, and a pool table. Would have enjoyed shooting a game of pool, but the cues were missing tips and there was no chalk. I think it was $1 per game, but could be wrong. The exercise room was fine, and also had a TV. There was a small business area also, and free wifi throughout the hotel. Left the laptop home with the rest of my business affairs for this trip, so didn't get to checkout the speed or signal reception. The food area was closed for the holiday, and maybe the winter season, but they did have a coffee machine in the lobby. The hotel is close to everything. Free on-site parking garage was secure. A pleasant stay all around. Yes, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We got to stay a little longer !!!!”
Reviews.Author: bernie35
Reviews.Content: Well this time we stayed for more than an overnight stay , we were there actually two days this time, the room was not the same as last time but it was still nice ,the outside pool was not open but the indoor pool, jacuzzi,sanua made up for it ....the view was really goregous the waves were so big due to the storms down south all the surfers we loving it the price was well worth it again , we should have checked the town events though the VW club was down for the weekend so it was wall to wall VW clubs with there nosiy cars , but overall we will go back but we will see who is in town .

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value for the money - and very clean!”
Reviews.Author: 8dozenroses
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I decided to get married on the spur of the moment and we had to find a place to go quickly that would not cost a lot of money. Since I could only get four days off from work, we decided on Ocean City, MD. Being a Jersey girl, I was a little skeptical but loving the ocean as I do, I figured it might be OK. I was a bit trepidatious about choosing a hotel. After much research (and reading some negative reviews regarding cleanliness), I settled on this facility because the price was right and it was on the ocean. I figured what the heck, I never clean my own house much so how bad could it be in comparison? I was in for a pleasant surprise. Immaculate. Large rooms. No one else around (imagine it might get a bit noisy in season). Balcony on the ocean (yes, it was worth paying more to have the waves lull us to sleep). Loved the jacuzzi bath tub. Sadly, the pool was only open some of the time but we were too in thrall with our ocean view to care much. In October, not much is open but we didn't mind at all. If you are an older couple on a limited budget, I highly recommend staying here during the fall/winter months when you will be basically by yourselves if you book during the week. I can see where Ocean City might get very noisy in the summer - which younger couples might not mind. I'm 53 and I don't need the headaches. No headaches here in October. OCEAN CITY, MD - unlike OCEAN CITY, NJ - is NOT dry! Hooray! This Jersey girl is sold. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: momoo
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute booking and we were expecting the worst room in the hotel. But when we checked in, we were wonderfully surprised at the room we were given. It was huge! And clean! And oceanfront! The room was so well prepared and clean that we would definitely reccommend this hotel and will stay there again. And there is a restaurant inside the hotel that serves breakfast so you don't need to go elsewhere.We didn't use the pool, but we did look in at it, and it looked very inviting. The best part was the staff. There was such a nice blond lady with glasses that greeted us when we checked in and she was so friendly and welcoming. Even the housekeeping staff would say hello, or good morning to you. A very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Had A Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Lilly033
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful week at this hotel. The staff was great and it made my week a very, very nice one! Everything was clean and nice and the managers told us the best places to eat. I was very impressed. Would like to come every few months!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and adaequate”
Reviews.Author: kayjay1110
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Quality Inn Beachront from August 23 to August 30. I was a little nervous because of some of the less flattering reviews I had read just before we left. We had traded RCI points for this accomodation. The room faced north, so we could see the bay to the left and the ocean to the right, but unfortunately did not get ocean front view. The room was clean, but small. We had a full size refrigerator, stove, and microwave. One of the outdoor pools was closed but the other pool was available. They also had an indoor pool but we did not use it. The room was comfortable. I was a little annoyed that the housekeeping staff did not clean up the kitchen - basically they cleaned the bathroom, made the bed and replaced the towels. It was definitely not as bad as other travelers had made it out to be, but I would rate it as average compared to other accomodations I've used. It was only a few blocks from the boardwalk which was convenient and it was close to many eating establishments. It also sits right on the beach as the name suggests. We did not eat at the hotel so cannot comment on that. Don't expect luxury and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel When Nothing Else Is Available”
Reviews.Author: MDMom58
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to go to DisneyWorld, but TS Fay messed up that, so I made a last minute reservation at the Quality Inn Beachfront. I tried other hotels first, but this was the only one I could find with availability for the dates I needed, Overall, the hotel is not bad and the location was good. I reserved two rooms and requested connecting rooms or adjoining rooms. This hotel does not have connecting rooms at all and the two rooms we got were fairly far apart. My girls and I were in 328 and DH and son were down the hall in 317. Not awful, but we wish we could have all been closer together since it was a family vacation. The rooms are extremely outdated. The carpet between the sleeping area and kitchen was frayed badly and I must have stepped on a carpet tack at least twice a day. Beds were comfortable, but small. I don't think two people could sleep in one bed comfortably. Room 328 had a view of the Hilton delivery area and if you looked to the left, you could see the ocean. Room 317 had a view of other rooms and if you looked down, you see the indoor pool. We never ate in the hotel restaurant and kids were disappointed that room service was not an option. We stocked up on snacks from the grocery store instead. We also never used the pools, so can't comment on that. Hotel staff were friendly. Housekeeping were always prompt in cleaning the room and giving us extras when asked. The lady who cleaned our room (didn't get her name) was very sweet. Parking was easy. It was nice to be able to park on the floor you were staying on and use your room key to enter through the parking garage. I think we would stay here again, only if the place was updated and/or I couldn't find something else. We all agreed that next time we visit OC we are going to try the Hilton next door.

Reviews.Title: “Go to the Hilton or Holiday”
Reviews.Author: familyfun48
Reviews.Content: We chose to take an unplanned vacation this year; therefore, when we called our usual hotel (Holiday Inn on 17th) all non-smoking rooms were booked. We decided to give the Quality Inn a try...we won't return. It was obvious that in the year 2004 and 2007 they rented to some wall writers....In various places in the room up in the corners you would see writing about "Tomcats 2004/2007". The hotel binder had never been replaced since 2004 when some "Tomcats" evidentally played a card game and decided to keep score in the binder. The dishwasher worked poorly and the stove rocked..litterally. I tried to adjust the leveling; however they were rusted tight. The air conditioner was very loud and blew directly on you when you were in bed. The worst part was not being able to enjoy the balcony as much as we would have liked. We had a non-smoking room on a non-smoking floor, but peole smoked a lot on their balcony and it blew right in our door. It was obvious how much people smoked in this place because the lawn facing the ocean was carpeted with cig. butts. I must say the view was great and the food downstairs was pretty good, but don't count on room service or lunch.

HotelInfo.Name: Quality Inn & Suites Beachfront Ocean City
HotelInfo.Address: Oceanfront at 33rd Street, Ocean City, MD 21842
